Disclaimer: I survivor main.

I play games for fun, not for competition, so the DBD community doesn't really get to me. If I get a bad killer that face camps, oh well. I die and move on to the next game. If I get a good killer who finds me immediately, hooks me (bc I can't juke whoops), and then patrol camps (which I'm 100% OK with), then no biggie. Next game please~

I think a lot of the community salt from killers comes from dealing with rank one survivors that don't actually play the game properly and just run around and flash the killer in the face. And while that is a legitimate strategy, it takes away from the fun of the game in my opinion.

As a killer (a horrible one), I've also been called names by survivors who tell me to 'get gud.' Older players ruin it for newer players or players who don't put in 1000s of hours. Just relax and have fun with the game! So what if you don't pip up - there is always the next game :)

That being said, this game is crazy fun. Don't let the saltiness of the community keep you from buying the game. Grab it, have fun with it, and ignore anyone who might give you a hard time ;) And don't fixate too much on the ranking process unless you're absurdly highly competitive for some reason (also fine - just try not to let it push you into spouts of anger!), and even then, recognize that there are jerks who play this game, like any other game, and have fun while you compete!

Pretty Fun and Scary, love it

Very unique and fun gameplay, although I can't recommend dbd. The issues with this game are very apparent once you reach the higher ranks (which will take a lot of time/ practice). At that point you will be quite invested, but the devs are completely tone deaf to any ideas that might fix the problems at that level. They are VERY slow at making any gameplay changes. There has been the same 1 game mode with 2 objectives for 5 years- though not from a lack of good ideas, but from sheer laziness and greed. Good luck swapping to a game with similar gameplay too, because it doesn't exist. 

They are making changes no one asked for while ignoring and actively doing the opposite of what dedicated players are asking for.. all with little to no communication/ transparency. There are over 130 survivor perks, yet the same 15 meta perks are constantly used. This shows how out of touch the devs are with their own game, and they have openly said that they do not balance this game around the higher ranks. That is 100% unacceptable and a total shame.. this game has so much potential. The maps are simply too big for a majority of the killers to be viable at the higher ranks. So what do they do? Well of course, they proceed to make the biggest map to date by far, an exact replica of the Raccoon City Police Station from Resident Evil. And size is only 1 of many, many gameplay issues with that map. Also.. WHY do players just drop dead when they disconnect from the game? It ruins the entire match for all remaining players.. and worst of all it's completely avoidable. They already have competent bots replace disconnected players in the mobile version of the game. Why has this not been implemented the PC/ console version yet? The problem is urgent and has been for years. I would not even hesitate to say that there is a manual disconnect in over 50% of all my games played. 

The performance for console players makes the purchase of this game a total sham. There are consistent and dramatic frame drops for console players.. the game is clearly not optimized well, which is another example of developer incompetence. They have simply bitten off more than they can chew with the current scope of their game, and it is certainly showing. I didn't even mention the absolute mound of game altering bugs that frequently occur, which is where a majority of the community anger lies.

I realize leaving a thumbs down seems silly when I still play this game occasionally and have over 1k hours. I just can't recommended someone spend so much time on this game learning all it takes to get to the higher ranks, only to face the above frustrations.

opened dbd, played survivor, walked into a trap bc quirky add ons, don't get rescued until struggle phase, walk into another trap and then I decide this is the worst game I have ever touched and will never play it again

GREAT game with a particularly fun progression/loadout system and honestly, haven't encountered much toxicity yet. There also aren't many ways to communicate during the game apart from game mechanics, so the experience is rarely ruined during the trial. Killers can be a bit troll-y but I think it adds to the experience if anything :D

This game has great balancing by putting players who are at a lower level/rank with other players of that same or close to same level/rank. Playing survivor is really challenging but the killers simpler mechanics are balanced by a lack of fov.

Just to preface, I first started playing dbd on console about 2.5 years back. I can say with confidence that the pc experience is vastly superior to any of way of playing this game. In addition to that, this game is the best it's been, ever. Popularity is at an all time high, and finding fun content to watch if you really start enjoying the game is easy. I highly recommend playing a full 4-man survivor stack with friends, as that is the best possible experience that this game has to offer. If you've never played dbd before and are thinking about getting into it now, there's really never been a better time to start (9.5/10).
its very hard to get into because of the rank reset that happens every month so if u get the game at the wrong time you would be going against people who have 1k + hours

Ehh, double-edged sword.

The game started to make fun after a few rounds of really trying to like this game because it's the favourite game of my girlfriend. Problem is that it is really insanely new player UNfriendly.

Toxic players that will grief you if you only make one mistake, overpowered Killers that seem uncounterable will worsen your early games and well the gameplay can be a bit meh sometimes.

Nonetheless, give it a try!
